item.title: Lokko PS5 open beta test now available
item.content:encoded:
• PS5

Help Lokko and his brother overcome the evil Goobol Corporation.

An open beta test for creative 3D platformer Lokko is now available for PlayStation 5 via PlayStation Store, developer Appy Monkeys announced.

Here is an overview of the game and beta, via its store page:

About the Beta

Lokko is currently in beta. Several features are limited in functionality or not present and may not work as expected. Features such as Car Editor, Track Editor, and Car Workshop are not present in the beta. All player inventory, content, and unlocks may reset when game exits Beta. We hope to gather all user feedback to improve the game and release a polished version for the final release.

About the Game

Help Lokko and his brother overcome the evil Goobol Corporation and deliver piping hot Pizzas worldwide!

Lokko is a unique 3D platformer where fun meets creativity. Build and share challenging levels across PlayStation 5, PC, and iOS seamlessly in real-time. Make your own character and design your enemies and bosses.

Leverage the power of DualSense on all three platforms. Players can share their creations and compete against their friends anytime, anywhere. Be the one who makes the best, most fun levels!

Key Features

  • Built-in level editors for platforming and car racing, players have the ability to generate and distribute their own levels. Hook up advanced level designs by chaining timers, accelerators and switches, placing NPCs and Bosses to make fun playable levels with your friends. Easy to use and intuitive controls with game controllers and keyboard / mouse support.
  • Built-in character editors allows you to customize your player character endlessly. Change the look of your character by deleting, adding and painting blocks with easy to use controls. Push your changes directly into all the Single Player levels and share your custom levels with the click of a button.
  • Change the look and behavior of all the NPC enemies by adding, deleting and painting blocks. Swap them into the Level Editor immediately to see how they behave in-game and in your user created levels.
  • Create customized racing tracks with an awesome track editor, build road curves, ramps and loops using your own forklift.
  • Instantly test your levels and drive in real-time without leaving the game.

Watch a new trailer below.

Open Beta Launch Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/lokko-ps5-open-beta-test-now-available

item.title: The Relic: First Guardian launches May 26, 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Dark fantasy action RPG dated.

The Relic: First Guardian, a dark fantasy action RPG with Soulslike elements, will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on May 26, 2026, publisher Perp Games and Korean developer Project Cloud Games announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Perp Games:

Inspired by Korean Folktales and Legends

Experience unique, blended gameplay, storytelling, and combat in this eight-minute slice of what’s soon to come. A rich tapestry of ancient tales is yearning to be unearthed where every story is woven into the fabric in the continent of Arsiltus—even amid combat. This is the unique experience awaiting in The Relic: First Guardian.

Bosses are Brutals

Featuring 70 formidable “Brutals,” each with a personal tale of sorrow, overcoming these massive bosses will require mastering the diverse combat system. Use a combination of unique weapons, magic, and skills tailored to your playstyle, all while crucially managing your stamina where every defense and dodge counts. Defeating each Brutal means The Last Guardian will inherit their tragic story, along with powerful special items and upgrades essential for progression.

Progression is Environmental

Exploring vast environments will lead you towards fragments that unlock more skills, armor, and weapons. Leave no stone unturned, no corner unexplored, and no dungeon uncompleted.

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/12/the-relic-first-guardian-launches-may-26-2026
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Famitsu Sales: 12/8/25 – 12/14/25
item.content:encoded:
• PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Switch 2 sales continue to boom.

Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for week of December 8, 2025 to December 14, 2025.

On the hardware side, Switch 2 sold 190,944 units, the Switch family sold 31,344 units, the PlayStation 5 family sold 18,912 units, the Xbox Series family sold 183 units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 13 units.

Get the full sales charts below.

Software Sales (followed by lifetime sales)

  1. [SW2] Mario Kart World (Nintendo, 06/05/25) – 103,861 (2,458,007)
  2. [NSW] Pokemon Legends: Z-A (The Pokemon Company, 10/16/25) – 50,292 (1,397,534)
  3. [SW2] Pokemon Legends: Z-A – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (The Pokemon Company, 10/16/25) – 40,813 (903,190)
  4. [SW2] Kirby Air Riders (Nintendo, 11/20/25) – 39,206 (327,824)
  5. [SW2] Momotaro Dentetsu 2: Anata no Machi mo Kitto Aru – Higashi Nihon Hen + Nishi Nihon Hen – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (Konami, 11/13/25) – 18,964 (132,058)
  6. [NSW] Momotaro Dentetsu 2: Anata no Machi mo Kitto Aru – Higashi Nihon Hen + Nishi Nihon Hen (Konami, 11/13/25) – 18,015 (177,007)
  7. [SW2] Donkey Kong Bananza (Nintendo, 07/17/25) – 12,519 (403,783)
  8. [NSW] Minecraft (Microsoft, 06/21/18) – 11,770 (4,078,169)
  9. [NSW] Animal Crossing: New Horizons (Nintendo, 03/20/20) – 9,513 (8,283,927)
  10. [SW2] Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment (Koei Tecmo, 11/06/25) – 8,001 (126,461)

Rankings 11 to 30 will be announced on December 19.

  1. [NSW] Octopath Traveler 0 (Square Enix, 12/04/25) –

  3. [PS5] Octopath Traveler 0 (Square Enix, 12/04/25) –
  4. [SW2] Octopath Traveler 0 (Square Enix, 12/04/25) –
  5. [NSW] Metroid Prime 4: Beyond (Nintendo, 12/04/25) –
  6. [SW2] Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake (Square Enix, 10/30/25) –
  7. [NSW] Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake (Square Enix, 10/30/25) –
  8. [SW2] Super Mario Party Jamboree – Nintendo Switch 2 Edition + Jamboree TV (Nintendo, 07/24/25) –
  9. [NSW] Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2 (Nintendo, 10/02/25) –
  10. [NSW] Super Smash Bros. Ultimate (Nintendo, 12/07/18) –
  11. [NSW] Super Mario Party Jamboree (Nintendo, 10/17/24) –
  12. [NSW] Mario Kart 8 Deluxe (Nintendo, 04/28/17) –
  13. [PS5] Ghost of Yotei (SIE, 10/02/25) –
  14. [NSW] Pokemon Scarlet / Pokemon Violet (The Pokemon Company, 11/18/22) –

Hardware Sales (followed by lifetime sales)
